column4: I've been dinking around this past hour (slow) learning regular expression bits and setting up this grep of a large file: grep -o "http://[^ ]*[/>]" big.file... I want to redirect it's output, but I also want to insert newlines between each found instance. Is that something I can put in the command, or do I need to write a script for that?
erUSUL, thanks for the info, I'll dig around in 'sed' mans some more to understand it better (hopefully). blaz_, ilovefairuz, thanks for that, I can still paste it if you want blaz_
i took it from the sed1liners.txt ;P
